directions:
Mix soy sauce, lime juice, canola oil, brown sugar, cumin, black pepper, chile powder, and garlic in bowl.

Set aside ½ cup of the marinade.

Use ziplock to marinate meat with rest of marinade for 3 to 10 hours.

Using ½ cup marinade, marinate peppers.

Grill steaks - cover and cook 1 min on each side and repeat until internal temp is 115° to 120°F for medium-rare or 125° to 130°F for medium.

Tent and foil steak on plate.

Meanwhile, move cast iron pan from cold side of grill to hot side and preheat for 2 min.

Cook veggies for about 10 min until charred. Stir occasionally. When cooked, move steak from plate to cutting board and add juices to veggies.

Thinly slice meat against grain.

Mix soy sauce, lime juice, canola oil, brown sugar, cumin, black pepper, chile powder, and garlic in bowl.

Set aside ½ cup of the marinade.

Use ziplock to marinate meat with rest of marinade for 3 to 10 hours.

Using ½ cup marinade, marinate peppers.

Grill steaks - cover and cook 1 min on each side and repeat until internal temp is 115° to 120°F for medium-rare or 125° to 130°F for medium.

Tent and foil steak on plate.

Meanwhile, move cast iron pan from cold side of grill to hot side and preheat for 2 min.

Cook veggies for about 10 min until charred. Stir occasionally. When cooked, move steak from plate to cutting board and add juices to veggies.

Thinly slice meat against grain.
html.ingredients: ½ cup soy sauce ½ cup lime juice (from 6 to 8 limes) ½ cup canola oil ¼ cup packed brown sugar 2 teaspoons ground cumin seed 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper 1 tablespoon chili powder (see the headnote) 3 medium cloves garlic, finely minced (about 1 tablespoon) 2 pounds trimmed skirt steak (about 1 whole steak), cut crosswise into 5- to 6-inch pieces (see here for trimming instructions) 1 large red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips 1 large yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips 1 large green bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips 1 white or yellow onion, cut into ½-inch slices 12 to 16 fresh flour or corn tortillas, hot 1 recipe Pico de Gallo Guacamole, sour cream, shredded cheese, and salsa, for serving, if desired

ingredients:
½ cup soy sauce½ cup lime juice (from 6 to 8 limes)½ cup canola oil¼ cup packed brown sugar2 teaspoons ground cumin seed2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper1 tablespoon chili powder (see the headnote)3 medium cloves garlic, finely minced (about 1 tablespoon)2 pounds trimmed skirt steak (about 1 whole steak), cutcrosswise into 5- to 6-inch pieces (see here for trimming instructions)1 large red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips1 large yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips1 large green bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into ½-inch-wide strips1 white or yellow onion, cut into ½-inch slices12 to 16 fresh flour or corn tortillas, hot1 recipe Pico de Gallo
Guacamole, sour cream, shredded cheese, and salsa, for serving, if desired
name: Fajitas
notes:
**Pico de Gallo**

1½ pounds ripe tomatoes, cut into ¼- to ½-inch dice (about3 cups, see Note above)Kosher salt½ large white onion, finely diced (about ¾ cup)1 to 2 serrano or jalapeño chiles, finely diced (seeds and membranes removed for a milder salsa)½ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves1 tablespoon lime juice from 1 lime

Toss  tomatoes with 1 tsp salt.  Drain for 20 - 30 min with strainer.

Combine with onion, chiles, cilantro, and lime juice.
